alert.note: Alert for Livingston; Monroe (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 12:55PM EST until February 24 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York... Genesee River At Avon affecting Livingston and Monroe Counties. For the Genesee River...including Wellsville, Portageville, Mt Morris Dam, Avon, Rochester, Honeoye Falls...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Genesee River At Avon. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 33.0 feet, Flood stage, river overflows at many areas from Geneseo to Scottsville, but mainly in agricultural lands with little damage to structures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 33.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 PM EST Wednesday was 33.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 33.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 33.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 33.4 feet on 03/06/1979. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 100 AM EST.
